N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5904.7 - Application by a Center for Advanced Technology for financial support

State Regulations
(a) Within 90 days
of its designation as a Center for Advanced Technology, and annually
thereafter, a Center for Advanced Technology may file an application for
financial support with the executive director on forms supplied by the
foundation and shall supply such information and data as the executive director
may require. (b) An application for
financial support filed pursuant to this section shall be limited to an
application for support for the following: (1)
the purchase of equipment and
fixtures; (2)
the employment of
faculty and support staff; (3)
the
provision of graduate fellowships; and
(4)
such other purposes as may from time to
time be approved by the board. In no event shall the foundation accept any application
financial support for the purpose of capital construction. (c) Any application for financial
support filed pursuant to this section shall be accompanied by documentation
satisfactory to the board that the applicant has commitments of support from
private and governmental, other than State, sources in amounts at least equal
to the amount requested from the foundation. (d) Any application for financial support
filed pursuant to this section shall be accompanied by a statement by the
applicant of any financial support previously received by the applicant
pursuant to this section. (e) An
application must be complete, in proper form and verified by the responsible
administrative and fiscal representative(s) of the applicant. (f) The executive director shall acknowledge
receipt of the application and shall notify the applicant if he finds that the
application is incomplete. Notes
